page.title: 18HOUSING AND WORK IN CAPEL
page.content: THE HOMES IN TUDELEY CONSIST MAINLY OF FARMS, AGRICULTURAL WORKERS COTTAGES AND BUNGALOWS, (SOME MODERNISED, SOME NEW), TWO GROUPS OF COUNCIL HOUSES (MANY NOW OWNER OCCUPIED) AND SOME FINE PROPERTIES IN POSTERN LANE. THERE ARE SEVERAL CONVERTED OASTS AND BARNS, CONSIDERED HIGHLY DESIRABLE. {BECAUSE OF NEW TECHNOLOGY AND GREATER {MECHANIZATION FARMERS NOW EMPLOY LESS {THAN A 1/4 OF FORMER WORKERS, CAUSING {A RADICAL CHANGE IN LOCAL EMPLOYMENT.} SCHOOL RECORDS SHOW THAT 100 YEARS AGO NEARLY 1/2 THE FATHERS WERE LABOURERS AND THE REST A RICH VARIETY OF MAINLY MANUAL WORKERS - BLACKSMITHS, CARTERS, CHARCOAL BURNERS AND WHEELWRIGHTS ETC. NAVVIES, PLATELAYERS AND ENGINEDRIVERS REVEALED THE ADVENT OF THE RAILWAY. FEW FATHERS WORK ON THE LAND NOW. MANY COMMUTE TO LONDON OR WORK IN LOCAL OFFICES, FACTORIES AND IN TRADE.
